 * [wiki:Harmonie_40h1 Harmonie-40h1].1.beta.2 See [wiki:ReleaseNotes/harmonie-40h1.1.beta.2]

 * [wiki:Harmonie_38h1 Harmonie-38h1].2 See [wiki:ReleaseNotes/harmonie-38h1.2]
 * [wiki:Harmonie_38h1 Harmonie-38h1].1 See [wiki:ReleaseNotes/harmonie-38h1.1]
 * [wiki:Harmonie_38h1 Harmonie-38h1].beta.3. See [wiki:ReleaseNotes/harmonie-38h1.beta.3]

 * [wiki:Harmonie_37h1 Harmonie-37h1].2. See [wiki:ReleaseNotes/harmonie-37h1.2]
 * [wiki:Harmonie_37h1 Harmonie-37h1].1. See [wiki:ReleaseNotes/harmonie-37h1.1]

 * [wiki:Harmonie_36h1 Harmonie-36h1].4. See [wiki:ReleaseNotes36h1.4]
 * [wiki:Harmonie_36h1 Harmonie-36h1].3.bf1, technical bugfix version of harmonie-36h1.3. See [wiki:ReleaseNotes36h1.3]
 * [wiki:Harmonie_36h1 Harmonie-36h1].3, the first official release of the HIRLAM meso-scale forecast system featuring AROME model at 2.5 km grid spacing, 3D-VAR and surface analysis using Gnumake-based build MAKEUP, is launched on 23 December 2010. See [wiki:ReleaseNotes36h1.3]
 * [wiki:Harmonie_36h1 Harmonie-36h1].2 is tagged on 29 October, 2010. This is a beta-release for further meteorological and technical evaluation
 * [wiki:Harmonie_36h1 Harmonie-36h1].1 is tagged on 2 July, 2010. This is an alfa version for technical testing

 * [wiki:Harmonie_35h1 Harmonie-35h1].4 is tagged on 14 June, 2010
 * [wiki:Harmonie_35h1 Harmonie-35h1].3 is tagged on 16 Dec, 2009
 * [wiki:Harmonie_35h1 Harmonie-35h1].2 is tagged on 7 May, 2009, defining ECMWF ecgate-c1a as default computer platform

 * [wiki:Harmonie_33h1 Harmonie-33h1] is tagged on 19 June, 2008, with 3DVAR and surface analysese enabled for coarse resolution domains
 * [wiki:Harmonie_33h0 Harmonie-33h0] is tagged on 22 April, 2008, featuring the first implementation of 3D-VAR in the script system 

 * [wiki:Harmonie_32h3 Harmonie-32h3] is tagged on 19 December, 2007, featuring the first implementation of mSMS in the script system.
 * [wiki:Harmonie_32h2 Harmonie-32h2] is tagged on 5 October, 2007. See [wiki:ReleaseNotesHarmonie-32h2]

 * [wiki:Harmonie_31h1 Harmonie-31h1] is tagged on 3 May, 2007

 * The [source:trunk trunk] version for Harmonie system, the developing HIRLAM meso-scale forecast system, is introduced on 30 November 2006 in the Hirlam source code repository with changeset [4792]. The acronym HARMONIE stands for "Hirlam Aladin Research toward Meso-scale Operational NWP in Europe", according to Prof. Peter Lynch, who initially made the proposal in Dec 2005
